meanings.definition: In a manner that is harsh or cruel in exercising power or authority over others.
meanings.sent1: The dictator ruled oppressively, silencing any opposition.
meanings.sent2: The teacher spoke oppressively to the students, making them feel small.
meanings.sent3: The cat oppressively demanded more treats, refusing to move until fed.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds hung oppressively over the city, threatening to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The oppressive heat of the desert sun beat down relentlessly on the weary travelers.

meanings.definition: In a way that causes discomfort or distress due to excessive weight or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The heavy backpack pressed oppressively on my shoulders as I trudged up the hill.
meanings.sent2: The silence in the room felt oppressively heavy, suffocating any conversation.
meanings.sent3: The pile of laundry grew oppressively high, mocking my attempts to conquer it.
meanings.sent4: The secret weighed oppressively on her mind, threatening to spill out at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave pressed oppressively against the explorers, filling them with unease.
